body_html:
Some is assigned to work on this internally. While we cannot promise an ETA, weeks is the estimate. I know this may seem hacky but I think you could wrap the model code and operations in a big "with" and get the results you want in the mean time. My python is not super strong and while I played with the JIT I never tried to wrap all of the operations this way. I do not see why it would not work. I might be over simplifying but trying this should not take too much effort to try.

 jit_scope = tf.contrib.compiler.jit.experimental_jit_scope

    x = tf.placeholder(np.float32)
    with jit_scope():
      y = tf.add(x, x)  # The "add" will be compiled with XLA.

body:
Some is assigned to work on this internally.  While we cannot promise an ETA, weeks is the estimate.  I know this may seem hacky but I think you could wrap the model code and operations in a big "with" and get the results you want in the mean time.  My python is not super strong and while I played with the JIT I never tried to wrap all of the operations this way.  I do not see why it would not work.  I might be over simplifying but trying this should not take too much effort to try.

```python
 jit_scope = tf.contrib.compiler.jit.experimental_jit_scope

    x = tf.placeholder(np.float32)
    with jit_scope():
      y = tf.add(x, x)  # The "add" will be compiled with XLA.
```
